xxl.core.indexStructures
Class Tree.IndexEntry

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.indexStructures.Tree.IndexEntry
Direct Known Subclasses:
ORTree.IndexEntry
Enclosing class:
Tree
public class Tree.IndexEntry
extends Object

This class describes the index entries (i.e. the entries of the non-leaf nodes) of a tree. Each index entry refers to a node which is the root of the subtree. We call this Node the subnode of the IndexEntry.

Field Summary
protected  Object id
          Handle used to lookup the node, which the index entry refers to, in its container.
protected  int parentLevel
          The level of the node this IndexEntry is stored in, or the height of the tree, respectively.

public Tree.IndexEntry initialize(Object id)
Initializes a (new created) IndexEntry.

Parameters:

Returns:
the IndexEntry itself (i.e. return this).

initialize

public Tree.IndexEntry initialize(Container container,
                                  Object id)
Initializes the (new created) IndexEntry. The default implementation only calls the method initialize(Object id).

Parameters:
id - the ID (in the underlaying container) of the Node refered to by the IndexEntry
container - the container in which the Node referred to by the IndexEntry is stored. In the default implementation the container is ignored because it is determined by Tree.getContainer.
Returns:
the IndexEntry itself (i.e. return this).
See Also:
Tree.getContainer

initialize

public Tree.IndexEntry initialize(Tree.Node.SplitInfo splitInfo)
Initializes the (new created) IndexEntry using some split information. The default implementation does not change the index entry and only returns it.

Parameters:
splitInfo - contains information about the split which led to create this index entry
Returns:
the index entry itself

initialize

public Tree.IndexEntry initialize(Container container,
                                  Object id,
                                  Tree.Node.SplitInfo splitInfo)
Initializes the (new created) IndexEntry. The implementation: 

                                initialize(splitInfo);
                                return initialize(container, id);

Parameters:
container - the container in which the node refered by the IndexEntry is stored
id - the ID (in the underlaying container) of the Node referred to by the IndexEntry
splitInfo - contains information about the split which led to create this IndexEntry
Returns:
the index entry itself
See Also:
initialize(Tree.Node.SplitInfo), initialize(Container,Object)

equals

public boolean equals(Object object)
Checks if two instances of IndexEntry are equal, i.e. if they have the same id and their Nodes are stored in the same container.

Overrides:
equals in class Object
Parameters:
object - the IndexEntry to which the current IndexEntry (this) has to be compared
Returns:
true if object is an IndexEntry and fulfills the mentioned conditions, false otherwise

level

public int level()
The level of the Node which the IndexEntry refers to. That is parentLevel-1.

Returns:
parentLevel-1.

container

public Container container()
Invokes the Function Tree.getContainer to determine the Container in which the Node referred to by this IndexEntry is stored. 

                                                return (Container)getContainer.invoke(this);

Returns:
the Container in which the Node referred to by this IndexEntry is stored

get

public Tree.Node get(boolean unfix)
Is used to get the Node to which this IndexEntry refers (subnode).

Parameters:
unfix - signals whether the Node can be removed from the underlying buffer
Returns:
the Node to which this IndexEntry refers

get

public Tree.Node get()
The same as get(true). That means that the node can be removed from the underlaying buffer.

Returns:
the Node referred to by this IndexEntry

Overwrites the Node refered by the current IndexEntry by a new Node.

Parameters:

unfix - signals whether the node can be removed from the underlying buffer

update

public void update(Tree.Node node)
Overwrites the subnode of the IndexEntry by a new Node. The node is unfixed, i.e. it can be removed form the underlying buffer.

Parameters:
node - the new node.
See Also:
update(Tree.Node,boolean)

remove

public void remove()
Removes the node referred to by the current IndexEntry from the container.

removeAll

public void removeAll()
Removes the complete subtree of this IndexEntry from the container.

See Also:
remove()

unfix

public void unfix()
Unfixes the node referred to by the current IndexEntry. After one call of unfix the underlaying buffer is allowed to remove this Node.

chooseSubtree

public Tree.IndexEntry chooseSubtree(Object object,
                                     Stack path)
Chooses the subtree which should be followed during an insertion operation. Let N be the node referred to by the current IndexEntry. The method returns the IndexEntry of N which refers to the subtree in which the search has to be continued. First Tree.down(Stack,Tree.IndexEntry) is called to put the MapEntry(this, N) on the Stack (path). Then Tree.Node.chooseSubtree(Descriptor, Stack) is called by N.chooseSubtree(descriptor,path) to choose the suitable IndexEntry of N.

Parameters:
object - the object which is looked for
path - a stack to store the path from the IndexEntry at which the search began to the returned one
Returns:
the next IndexEntry in whose subtree the search has to be continued

chooseSubtree

public Tree.IndexEntry chooseSubtree(Descriptor descriptor,
                                     Stack path)
Chooses the subtree which should be followed during an search operation. Let N be the subnode of the current IndexEntry. The method returns the IndexEntry of N which refers to the subtree in which the search has to be continued. First Tree.down(Stack,Tree.IndexEntry) is called to put the MapEntry(this, N) on the Stack (path). Then Tree.Node.chooseSubtree(Descriptor, Stack) is called by N.chooseSubtree(descriptor,path) to choose the suitable IndexEntry of N.

Parameters:
descriptor - the descriptor which is looked for
path - a stack to store the path from the IndexEntry, at which the search began, to the returned one
Returns:
the next IndexEntry in whose subtree the search has to be continued

growAndPost

public void growAndPost(Object data,
                        Stack path)
This method is used to insert a data object into the subnode of the current IndexEntry. The insertion can lead to an overflow. The method treats this problem by calling Tree#post(path)

Parameters:
data - the object to insert
path - a Stack to store the path from the IndexEntry, at which the operation began, to the subnode of this IndexEntry.
